name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-Chlorophenyl group: The introduction of the 3-chlorophenyl group increases the melting point due to the additional rigidity and pi-system. Each phenyl group may contribute around +30 to +50°C. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and increase the melting point by approximately +10°C. The fluorine atoms increase the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, contributing approximately +10°C each.
